Q1: Although all objects extend 'java.lang.Object' the 'null' type is not an object
Q2: If 'NullPointerException' were compiler checked you would never get any real code written...
Q3: Marker interfaces were what Java used before annotations to signify that a class was special
Q4: REM There is no equivalence between booleans and numbers and '1.2' is a double by default
